FuncDef:
The interval command sets a measurement interval for an iFIT instance.
The undo interval command restores the default measurement interval for an iFIT instance.
By default, the measurement interval for an iFIT instance is 30 second.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a measurement interval for an iFIT instance.
The value can be 10, 30, 60, or 300, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A measurement interval for an iFIT instance is the period between starting to count the number of packets or bytes and recording the send and receive timestamps.
To implement iFIT performance statistics and ensure measurement accuracy, run the interval command to set a measurement interval for an iFIT instance based on the clock offset, maximum transmission delay, and system performance.
Prerequisites
An iFIT instance has been created.
